title: Can everything and nothing coexist? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nothing …. is no thing so it can not coexist, simply because it is nothing. Have not scientists proven that on looking at the micro level there is just space and matter is not matter at all but space? So everything is appearing from nothing as nothing and it is all matter? The appearance of matter is the way we can see nothing, as nothing can not be directly experienced …. by itself, so matter is manifest so nothing can experience everything in space and time. It is nothing which is pure potential of everything , wanting to experience itself. So the personal is simply identification to the particular action figure moving through space and time now. Life…. the beautiful expression of life we are now is eternal while we come and go in form while ultimately formless. Everything , or form is our way of seeing nothing through a filter, as nothing is too incomprehensible to the brain. Form (as the void) is strung out as space and time so it is a little more digestible. Lol. I could be making all this up I don't know? I just wrote it. Love.

Yes, its what we call normal “space”. What happens to the bodies when you try to cram both into the same space? This is what people tend to confuse the Pauli Exclusion Principle as. They can’t take into account kinetic dynamic of substance (they only treat it as “at rest” in terms of physics; that’s probabilty for you, a majority gives you the same result as a hundred percent certainty, now it inaccurately describes the item’s dynamic interaction of ‘state”. Natural Matter cannot occupy the exact same space. Technically, everything that item is, exists in that spot while nothing else does… (But there will be overlap of fields and energies generated or influenced by the entirety of the matter, as a whole, or one mass. So applied to the last extrapolation, the “nothing” gets eliminated from the equation by < matter but better defined by “mass of”.)

Nothing cannot coexist because it cannot exist, it is nothing. However, in the idea of all that is, there is the idea of all that isn’t - it is inherent in existence or something-ness that there be non-existence and nothingness. What exists is simply the opposite of what doesn’t and vice versa. Can they coexist? Bad choice of words. Can they both at the same time? Yes. (this is not a typo - the verb has been omitted because any verb is to be)

I’m pretty sure this is less a question, than a string of random words put together in a vaguely sentence like structure. But I’ll take a crack at it. Nothing can coexist with anything, because nothing doesn’t really exist. And if it can coexist with anything, it can coexist with everything.
Neither exist. There is no such thing as “everything.” And Science clearly shows us, even in space where there appears to be “nothing,” there are roiling virtual particles. “Nothing,” does not exist.
Nothing (no thing) is a subset of everything (every thing). Pick an empty group from some number of things and you have no thing.
Time and Space co-exist. If Time isn’t “nothing” what is?
